did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Telegrams, logbook transcripts of telegrams, and memoranda, relating to Polish-Dutch relations during the interwar period. A digital copy of this entire collection is available at http://szukajwarchiwach.pl/800/47/0/-/.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Poland. Poselstwo (Netherlands) records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternative Forms of Material Available
altformavail.p: Digital copy in Poland's National Digital Archive at http://szukajwarchiwach.pl/800/47/0/-/. It was digitized from microfilm by the Polish State Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a good portion of the secret correspondence sent and received by the Polish legation in the Netherlands during the interwar period, relating to Polish-Dutch relations, as well as of memoranda in preparation for an international peace conference in the early 1930s. It serves not only as a good source for the study of the international tensions that led to the outbreak of World War II but also provides good coverage of the first two months of the conflict.

Of particular interest are the telegrams exchanged with Warsaw at the time of the Russo-Polish War of 1920, reflecting Poland's attempts to acquire arms in Western Europe and diplomatic moves to prevent an international blockade on deliveries by workers sympathizing with the Bolsheviks.
These records were formerly part of the Polish Foreign Ministry collection, acquired by the Hoover Archives in 1959, and were accessioned in the early 1990s as a separate collection.
A microfilm copy of these materials has been deposited in the State Archives of Poland in Warsaw.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Logbook of incoming and outgoing reports
Incoming and outgoing telegrams, arranged chronologically
Logbook of incoming and outgoing telegrams and letters
Memoranda relating to preparations for an international disarmament conference, to Polish-German relations, and to conditions in Germany

did.unittitle: Logbook of incoming and outgoing reports, 1928 November - 1931 May
Logbook of incoming and outgoing telegrams and letters, 1937 - 1939 October

scopecontent.p: Memoranda relating to preparations for an international disarmament conference, to Polish-German relations, and to conditions in Germany
